title: 108_hr4788
content: The Act is titled the "National Guard and Reservists Education Benefits Act." It provides block grants to states for tuition assistance for members of the Selected Reserve. The Secretary of Education will implement a program of block grants to States for tuition and fees at public institutions of higher learning for Selected Reserve members. Tuition assistance is not available to those already receiving educational assistance under specific codes. States must submit certifications by October 1 each fiscal year to receive funding. The CEO of the State must certify to the Secretary the use of funds for tuition, return unused funds, and comply with reporting requirements. The Secretary will pay each State an amount for tuition assistance for Selected Reserve members. The State CEO must certify fund usage for tuition, return unused funds, and comply with reporting. Unused funds must be returned to the Secretary within 3 years. The Secretary will redistribute unused funds to States that have expended their allotment or did not submit certification by October 1. (e) Reporting Requirements.--Each State receiving an allotment for tuition assistance must monitor and evaluate the program as determined by the Secretary. States must submit annual reports on the program to the Secretary. The Secretary shall allot funds to each State based on the number of members of the Selected Reserve residing in the State. Minimum allotments are specified to ensure a certain level of funding for each State. The Secretary will allocate funds to States based on the number of Selected Reserve members residing in each State. Minimum allotments are set to guarantee a certain level of funding. For most States, 1% of the appropriated amount will be allocated, while for specific territories, 0.5% will be allocated. Pro rata reductions will be made as needed to comply with the requirements. $100,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated annually from 2005 to 2010. The Secretary will allocate funds to States based on the number of Selected Reserve members residing in each State. Minimum allotments are set to guarantee a certain level of funding. $100,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated annually from 2005 to 2010 for making allotments to States under this section. Definitions include Selected Reserve, Secretary, institution of higher education, and State. The term "State" refers to each of the 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and the Northern Mariana Islands. "Tuition and fees for undergraduate studies" includes the actual cost of tuition, fees, books, and supplies for public higher education institutions.
